section.name: INTRODUCTION TO MICROBIOLOGY AND HUMAN BIOCHEMISTRY

comments:
NURS 042 is a course on Cellular Biochemistry, Microbiology, and Molecular Genetics.  The goal of the course is to gain an understanding of the fundamental processes of living organisms.  Subjects to be studied include prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells, the structure and function of major biomolecules, metabolic pathways, molecular genetics and immunology.  There is both a lecture and laboratory component to this course.   

   Overall students found the textbook as helpful and useful especially as a reference and review tool before tests.  Students reported that recitation was essential in learning the material, particularly when clickers were used.  The subject matter covered in this course is essential to nursing education.  One student wrote, “I learned more useful information from this course than most others I have taken.  It really helped pull together knowledge I already had in a useful way.” 

   Students found Dr. Lafferty to be “a favorite professor” and “wonderful”.  One student reported, “[Dr. Lafferty] really helped me when I was having trouble with the course.  She is always willing to give her time.”  The personal atmosphere of the class was appreciated by the students and one student added, “Dr. Lafferty knew my name almost immediately even though the class is huge.” 

   Traditionally, this course is taken by freshman in the Nursing School.  However, the course is recommended for those who need to fulfill a biology requirement.

section.name: INTRODUCTION TO MICROBIOLOGY AND HUMAN BIOCHEMISTRY
